trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of panels in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class stores the panels displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.

Each object in the collection is an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class which defines the display characteristics and behaviors of a panel displayed in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
There are a number of ways to add panels to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method provides the ability to add a single panel to the collection.

To add a number of panels to the collection, you create an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects and assign it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
If you want to insert a panel at a specific location within the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Insert%2A> method.

To remove panels, you can use either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Remove%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method if you know where the panel is located within the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Clear%2A> method enables you to remove all panels from the collection instead of using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a single panel at a time.
In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing panels, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> also provides methods to find panels within the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a panel is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the panel is located within the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the panel is located within the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control that contains this collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified text to the collection.
You can add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control to display more than one type of information.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> with the text specified in the `text` parameter and adds it to collection.

The order in which panels are located in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> represents the order that panels are displayed within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
Panels are displayed from left to right starting with the first panel in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control does not change the order in which panels are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
To insert a panel at a specific position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Insert%2A> method.
To add a set of panels to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The text for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> that is being added.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> that represents the panel that was added to the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to the collection.
You can add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control to display more than one type of information.

This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> specified in the `value` parameter to the collection.

The order in which panels are located in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> represents the order that panels are displayed within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
Panels are displayed from left to right starting with the first panel in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control does not change the order in which panels are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
To insert a panel at a specific position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Insert%2A> method.
To add a set of panels to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> that represents the panel to add to the collection.
The zero-based index of the item in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> being added to the collection was `null`.
The parent of the specified in the value parameter is not `null`.
Adds an array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> objects to the collection.
You can add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control to display more than one type of information.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.AddRange%2A> method adds an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects specified in the `panels` parameter to the collection.
All existing panels in the collection are removed from the collection before inserting new panels.

The order in which panels are located in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> represents the order that panels are displayed within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
Panels are displayed from left to right starting with the first panel in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control does not change the order in which panels are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
To add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method.

To insert a panel at a specific position in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control (and in this collection), use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Insert%2A> method.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> objects to add.
The array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> objects being added to the collection was `null`.
Removes all items from the collection.
When you remove panels from the collection, all information about the deleted panels is lost.

To remove a single panel from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
Determines whether the specified panel is located within the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a panel is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the item is located within the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the panel is located within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if the panel is located within the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the collection contains a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false.`
The name of the item to find in the collection.
`true` to indicate the collection contains a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of panels in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> objects in the collection.
Returns an enumerator to use to iterate through the item collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the item collection.
Returns the index within the collection of the specified panel.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.IndexOf%2A> method enables you to determine where a panel is located within the collection.
To determine whether an item is located within the collection before calling this method, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Contains%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index where the panel is located within the collection; otherwise, negative one (-1).
Returns the index of the first occurrence of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified key.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to find in the collection.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified key, if found; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> into the collection at the specified index.
You can add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control to display more than one type of information.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Insert%2A> method enables you to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> and insert it at a specific location within the collection.

The order in which panels are located in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> represents the order that panels are displayed within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
Panels are displayed from left to right starting with the first panel in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control does not change the order in which panels are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
To add a panel to the end of the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method.
To add a set of panels to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The zero-based index location where the panel is inserted.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> representing the panel to insert.
The value parameter is `null`.
The value parameter's parent is not `null`.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than the value of the property of the class.
The property of the value parameter's panel is not a valid value.
Gets a value indicating whether this collection is read-only.
This property is always `false` for this collection.
`true` if this collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an item with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Item%2A> returns `null.`
The name of the item to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified key.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> at the specified index.
You can use this method to obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> stored at a specific location within the collection.
To determine the index of a specific panel within the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The index of the panel in the collection to get or set.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> representing the panel located at the specified index within the collection.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> assigned to the collection was `null`.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> from the collection.
When you remove a panel from the list, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.
All information about the removed panel is deleted.
You can use this method to remove a specific panel from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> by specifying the actual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> to remove from the collection.
To specify the index of the panel to remove instead of the panel itself, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To remove all panels from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> representing the panel to remove from the collection.
The assigned to the value parameter is `null`.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> located at the specified index within the collection.
When you remove a panel from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent panels in the collection.
All information about the removed panel is deleted.
You can use this method to remove a specific panel from the list by specifying the index of the panel to remove from the collection.
To specify the panel to remove instead of the index to the panel, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To remove all panels from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the class.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to remove from the collection.
Copies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection"></xref> to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The type in the collection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> that represents the panel to add to the collection.
value is not a .
-or-
The parent of value is not `null`.
Determines whether the specified panel is located within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if panel is a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> located within the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index of the specified panel within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of panel, if found, within the entire collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> into the collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index location where the panel is inserted.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> that represents the panel to insert.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than the value of the `Count` property.
value is not a .
-or-
The parent of value is not `null`.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
value is not a .
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> that represents the panel to remove from the collection.
